title: Monthly Treeverse Update #25
content:
An update on Treeverse. A look at our development and art team progress. We will be posting monthly for you to follow along the development of Treeverse, so make sure you subscribe!

The end of 2023, moving into the start of 2024. What a year! Jumping straight into it, we’ve announced the application form to apply for the Treeverse developer build. Use this link to apply and check out the post. Official dates will be announced soon.

Form

ICYMI: At the start of the month we announced a funding round where we raised ~$3M from various funds and angels.

2023 has honestly been a year where every monthly update outshines the previous one. It’s now gotten to the stage where you will just see gameplay, play it; experience it for yourself.

*Psst—Wanted to get complete sound for this update as a BANGING release, but you will have to wait a few days as we finalize implementation!

In the meantime, here are a bunch of videos:

Could not load video.

*excuse the bad compression on the GIFs if you see any, all of these VFX are in-game, expect next month to be full of video content from users

Art Update

By Scott

The art team has slowly moved into a full-on content production mode, going forward this will likely be the case for more of the future updates, which we expect to be more simple content sharing, here are some of the work made this month!

Engineering

by Aizea

New Features

  • New saving system

    • we previously had a completely hard coded saving system, its a lot smarter now and saves in batches

    • Also includes a logging system to track changes

  • Decouple ability ranges from movement ranges in an ability

  • Timeline / Animation based camera shakes

  • VSFX implementation

    • Material switching, flash effects, camera effects and spawning emitters

    • Audio implementation

      • We have written the base audio implementation for the game. It’s still early and primitive, but will continue to be worked on

  • Character Creation re implementation

    • Using the new saving system now

  • Release Early System

    • When you die, you enter last stand mode. You can now release last stand early

  • Destruction after death

    • Monsters used to hang around forever when they died, they get cleaned up now

  • Add Level Locks to Dungeons

    • Prevent players entering dungeons without sufficient level

  • Experience Bar

    • You can view your experience bar and track your progress now

  • Improve UI for learning new blueprint

  • Improve UI for receiving and selling items

  • Ability Cancel area

    • Can now cancel your ability

  • Improve UI tooltips

    • Various UIs now have tooltips to view information about the items

  • Interactable Icons

    • Billboards appear on top of the nearest interactable thing now

  • Click on players to invite them to party

  • Add rotation to inventory preview

  • Minimap system

    • Previously just had a separate camera looking down on player, now we have a real minimap with markers

  • Add quest markers

  • Scene Music Implementation

    • When you enter new scene, you can now play music

Fixes

  • Crowd Control Effect Fixes

  • Hit Stop Fix

  • Fix bug when knockback wouldn’t apply properly to monsters that run at you

  • Fix NPC interactions

  • Fix connection issues

  • Fix level up missing issues

  • Addressables corruption fix

  • Fix scene relevancy issues

  • Fix null component issue in builds

  • Fix damage calculation stats

    • Changed the formula for calculating damage

  • Update potion usage

  • Fix rotation issues near interactables/gatherables

  • Message logs now queue via RPC on clients

Going Forward

Simply put, 2024 is the year we are going into mass production. 2023 was the year of setting up the base, and we’ve accomplished just that. You will be able to see it in the developer build. We are excited to get feedback from our community with real playable builds out!

Again: “It can only get better from here.”

Disclaimer: Please note that anything written in this document should not be taken as financial advice. Endless Clouds is dedicated to producing a fun, enjoyable game that integrates NFTs. NFTs are a new and highly experimental technology and should not be bought for investment purposes.
